summary: This is an FAA aircraft registration statement for Hyperion Air, LLC, filed in August 2013. It identifies Jeffrey E. Epstein as the sole member and Lawrence Visoski as the sole manager of the company, which was organized in the US Virgin Islands in October 2012. The document certifies the company's eligibility to register aircraft as a US citizen entity.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.role: Sole Member of Hyperion Air, LLC
persons.context: Identified as the sole member and a US citizen individual owner of Hyperion Air, LLC, the company registering an aircraft.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.role: Sole Manager of Hyperion Air, LLC
persons.context: Identified as the sole manager and a US citizen individual managing Hyperion Air, LLC, and signed the registration statement.

connections.description: Epstein is the sole member (owner) of Hyperion Air, LLC, and Visoski is the sole manager of the company, indicating a business/employment relationship.

events.title: Formation of Hyperion Air, LLC
events.description: Hyperion Air, LLC was lawfully organized in the United States Virgin Islands.

events.title: FAA Aircraft Registration Filing
events.description: The LLC Statement in Support of Registration for Hyperion Air, LLC was filed with the FAA Aircraft Registry in Oklahoma City.

locations: United States Virgin Islands (jurisdiction where Hyperion Air, LLC was organized)
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma (location of FAA Aircraft Registry where document was filed)
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein is identified as the sole member (owner) and a U.S. citizen individual behind the aircraft-holding company Hyperion Air, LLC.
Lawrence Visoski is identified as the sole manager of Hyperion Air, LLC and signed the FAA registration document.
Hyperion Air, LLC was organized in the United States Virgin Islands in October 2012.
The document was filed with the FAA Aircraft Registry in Oklahoma City on August 13, 2013, to register an aircraft in the company's name.
The registration certifies that the LLC meets U.S. citizenship requirements for aircraft ownership, with Epstein and Visoski both verified as U.S. citizens.
